https://www.wyzant.com/resources/answers.query: A company makes three types of candy and packages them in three assortments. Assortment I contains 4 sour, 4 lemon, and 12 lime candies and sells for $9.40. Assortment II contains 12 sour, 4 lemon, and 4 lime candies and sells for $7.60. Assortment III contains 8 sour, 8 lemon, and 8 lime candies and sells for $11.00. Manufacturing costs per piece of candy are $0.20 for sour, $0.25 for lemon, and $0.30 for lime candies. The company can make 5,200 sour, 3,800 lemon, and 6,000 lime candies weekly. What will be the constraints to solve this problem with linear programming?
